message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.OS, cs.SY, cs.DC

Reasoning: 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely category as the paper proposes a novel intrusion survivability approach to withstand ongoing intrusions.
- cs.SE (Software Engineering) is also likely as the paper discusses the orchestration of fine-grained recovery and per-service responses.
- cs.OS (Operating Systems) is relevant as the proposed approach is implemented on a Linux-based prototype and aims to maintain the availability of core functions while waiting for patches to be deployed.
- cs.SY (Systems and Control) is relevant as the paper proposes a system-level approach to intrusion survivability.
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is less likely but still relevant as the paper discusses the performance overhead of the proposed approach.
